item.description:
Hi All,

MJ O'Connor's Irish Pub is next to the Boston Park Plaza Hotel.
From the Green T-line, it's the Arlington stop.

After we spend a little time introducing ourselves and what our personal interests in the philosophy of mind are, we'll discuss the "Chinese Room". This is a famous debate in Artificial Intelligence and there's a ton of stuff written on it that's easy to get to. As usual, the Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy is a great resource -- but there are shorter versions to read!

The issue is usually framed as the question: is computation alone (syntax) enough to create meaning (semantics)? John Searle's "Chinese Room" is meant to be a killer proof that computation alone is never enough. It's hugely controversial, with lots of MF-BSers (Mighty Famous Big-Shots) vehemently arguing both sides; so with brew in hand it should be a fun discussion!

See ya then,
Sean

group.name: The Boston Philosophy of Mind Group

item.name: First Meeting: The Chinese Room
